verses.text: Moses summoned all Israel and said to them, "Hear, O Israel, the statutes and the ordinances that I speak in your hearing today, and learn them and be careful to do them."
verses.comment: Opening call for attention and obedience; 'statutes and ordinances' translate Hebrew terms 'chukkim' and 'mishpatim'.

verses.text: The LORD our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
verses.comment: Horeb is another name for Sinai.

verses.text: The LORD did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, we who are all here alive today.
verses.comment: "Not with our fathers" means the covenant is renewed with the current generation.

verses.text: The LORD spoke with you face to face at the mountain, out of the midst of the fire.
verses.comment: Figurative for direct communication; see also Deut. 4:33.

verses.text: I stood between the LORD and you at that time, to declare to you the word of the LORD; for you were afraid because of the fire, and you did not go up on the mountain. He said:
verses.comment: Moses acted as mediator. See also Deut. 18:16.

verses.text: "I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery."
verses.comment: Preface to the Ten Commandments.

verses.text: "You shall have no other gods before Me."
verses.comment: Literally, 'before My face'; exclusive worship of YHWH.

verses.text: "You shall not make for yourself a carved image, any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or on the earth beneath, or in the waters under the earth."
verses.comment: 'Carved image' translates 'pesel'; no physical representations.

verses.text: "You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, to the third and fourth generation of those who hate Me,"
verses.comment: 'Jealous' in the sense of passionate exclusivity.

verses.text: "but showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love Me and keep My commandments."
verses.comment: 'Steadfast love' renders Hebrew 'chesed'.

verses.text: "You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not hold anyone guiltless who takes His name in vain."
verses.comment: 'Take in vain' means misuse, especially by false oaths.

verses.text: "Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as the LORD your God commanded you."
verses.comment: 'Observe' replaces 'remember' (as in Exodus); distinct emphasis in Deuteronomy.

verses.text: "Six days you shall labor and do all your work,"
verses.comment: Standard command to work six days.

verses.text: "but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the LORD your God. On it you shall not do any work, you, or your son or your daughter, or your male servant or your female servant, or your ox or your donkey or any of your livestock, or the sojourner who is within your gates, so that your male servant and your female servant may rest as you do."
verses.comment: 'Sojourner' refers to a foreign resident.

verses.text: "You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God brought you out from there with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm; therefore the LORD your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day."
verses.comment: Different rationale than Exodus—here focused on deliverance from slavery.

verses.text: "Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God commanded you, so that your days may be long and that it may go well with you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you."
verses.comment: "May go well with you" adds to Exodus version.

verses.text: "You shall not murder."
verses.comment: 'Murder' is precise for Hebrew 'ratsach'; not generically 'kill.'

verses.text: "You shall not commit adultery."
verses.comment: Direct translation; the commandment is explicit.

verses.text: "You shall not steal."
verses.comment: General command against theft.

verses.text: "You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor."
verses.comment: "Neighbor" refers to fellow Israelite or member of the community.

verses.text: "You shall not covet your neighbor's wife. And you shall not desire your neighbor's house, his field, or his male servant or his female servant, his ox or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor's."
verses.comment: 'Field' added versus Exodus version; split of wife and property clarifies order.

verses.text: These words the LORD spoke to all your assembly at the mountain out of the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness, with a loud voice; and He added no more. And He wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
verses.comment: "He added no more" emphasizes the exclusivity of the Ten Commandments.

verses.text: When you heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, you came near to me, all the heads of your tribes and your elders.
verses.comment: Describes the representatives of all Israel.

verses.text: And you said, "Behold, the LORD our God has shown us His glory and His greatness, and we have heard His voice out of the midst of the fire. Today we have seen that God speaks with man, and he lives."
verses.comment: Israel recognizes the unique event of surviving God's voice.

verses.text: Now therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear the voice of the LORD our God anymore, we shall die.
verses.comment: Fear of death from God’s overwhelming presence.

verses.text: For who is there of all flesh, who has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and has lived?
verses.comment: "All flesh" meaning all humanity.

verses.text: Go near and hear all that the LORD our God says; and then speak to us all that the LORD our God speaks to you, and we will hear and do it.
verses.comment: Israel requests Moses continue as mediator.

verses.text: And the LORD heard your words when you spoke to me. And the LORD said to me: 'I have heard the words of this people, which they have spoken to you. They are right in all that they have spoken.'
verses.comment: Affirms Israel’s request for a mediator.

verses.text: 'Oh that they had such a heart as this always, to fear Me and to keep all My commandments, so that it might go well with them and with their children forever!'
verses.comment: "Oh that they had..."—God's longing for Israel's enduring faithfulness.

verses.text: 'Go and say to them, "Return to your tents."'
verses.comment: Direction for the people to depart.

verses.text: 'But as for you, stand here by Me, and I will speak to you all the commandments and the statutes and the ordinances that you shall teach them, so that they may do them in the land that I am giving them to possess.'
verses.comment: Moses’ unique role as teacher and mediator.

verses.text: So you shall be careful to do as the LORD your God has commanded you. You shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
verses.comment: "Right or left"—a Hebrew idiom for complete obedience.

verses.text: You shall walk in all the way that the LORD your God has commanded you, so that you may live, and that it may go well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land that you shall possess.
verses.comment: Summarizes the blessings of obedience: life, prosperity, and longevity.
